definition: line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: The educational program and diplomas obtained are recognised as in France.
sentences.chinese: 教育体制和获得的毕业证书在法国也被承认。

sentences.english: If you fail in compulsory courses, you'll not be granted the graduation diploma.
sentences.chinese: 如果必修课不及格，就不能颁发毕业证书。

sentences.english: If you don't  pass the compulsory courses, you cannot be granted the graduation diploma.
sentences.chinese: 如果必修课不及格，就不能颁发毕业证书。

sentences.english: Upon admission, applicants must present the original copy of their certificates; otherwise their admission qualification will be canceled.
sentences.chinese: 录取报到时缴验毕业证书正本，否则取消录取资格。

sentences.english: The diploma that uses you goes notarial good.
sentences.chinese: 就用你的毕业证书去公证一下就好了。

sentences.english: One has to pass the English tests to get his certifications.
sentences.chinese: 只有通过了罅英语考试，才能拿到毕业证书。

sentences.english: Beijing Higher Education Self-Study Examination Certificate of Graduation.
sentences.chinese: 北京高等教育自学考试毕业证书。

sentences.english: Or because a high school diploma doesn’t mean what it used to?
sentences.chinese: 还是因为中学毕业证书不再拥有它过去的意义？

sentences.english: Graduates must complete all gown return procedures prior to the collection of their academic award parchments.
sentences.chinese: 请同学在领取毕业证书前，先办理还袍事宜。

definition: certificate of partial completion/certificate of attendance (for a student who did not graduate)
student graduating in the current year/recent graduate
